page.title: 09LYTHAM SEAFRONT CONTINUED
page.content: {Charlie's Mast}a prominent landmark was once used for signalling to sailing vessels using Lytham Dock. {Lytham Pier}was also a seafront feature,however,it was destroyed by fire in 1960. {Lytham Windmill}the most famous landmark was built in 1805.It was used for grinding corn and making flour.In 1919 the 4 sails were blown in the wrong direction-so ruining the machinery and causing a fire in the mill. There are now plans to convert the windmill into a working museum grinding flour for sale to tourists. However,insufficient funds are available from the Council.Such plans are likely to be further delayed as serious rising damp has just been dicovered.
